channel.title: Creative method
channel.description:
This companion series for The Creative Mind presents radio essays on a creative activity by an outstanding representative of that activity. Dr. Lyman Bryson hosts.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Gyorgy Kepes on design
item.description: This program presents Gyorgy Kepes discussing successful creative methods for design.
item.dc:creator: Cavness, Bill
item.dc:subject: Kepes, Gyorgy, 1906-2001

item.title: Dore Schary on production
item.description: This program presents Dore Schary discussing successful creative methods for producing films.
item.dc:creator: Cavness, Bill
item.dc:subject: Schary, Dore--Interviews.

item.title: Edward Steichen on photography
item.description: This program presents Edward Steichen discussing successful creative methods in photography.
item.dc:creator: Cavness, Bill
item.dc:subject: Steichen, Edward, 1879-1973

item.title: George Shearing on jazz
item.description: This program presents George Shearing discussing successful creative methods for performing jazz.
item.dc:creator: Cavness, Bill
item.dc:subject: Shearing, George--Interviews.

item.title: Richard Tucker on singing
item.description: This program presents Richard Tucker discussing successful creative methods for singing.
item.dc:creator: Cavness, Bill
item.dc:subject: Tucker, Richard, 1913-1975

item.title: Leopold Stokowski on conducting

item.dc:subject: Stokowski, Leopold, 1882-1977
